revised_title: Seismic Research at the Bernard Price Institute of Geophysical Research
tldr: The article discusses the research conducted at the Bernard Price Institute of Geophysical Research, focusing on seismic studies and crustal structure analysis. The author highlights the Institute's work on understanding the causes and effects of earth tremors in Johannesburg, as well as the study of seismic waves and crustal thickness. The research also explores the possibility of an intermediate layer in the Earth's crust and its implications for understanding the Earth's structure and history.
